content.summary: This section outlines the procedures for serving legal documents such as process, pleadings, or other papers on non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents. It specifies how service can be made through appointed agents and the role of the Commission's Secretary in forwarding documents. It also provides definitions for terms like 'Managing agent', 'Non-resident', and 'Principal office and place of business'.

elements.title: Service of process on non-resident entities
elements.statement: A person may serve process, pleadings, or other papers on a non-resident investment adviser, or on a non-resident general partner or non-resident managing agent of an investment adviser by serving any or all of its appointed agents.

terms.reason: The term is a general reference to an individual or entity.

The verb phrase indicates the method of performing the action.

elements.title: Furnishing documents to the Commission
elements.statement: A person may serve a non-resident investment adviser, non-resident general partner, or non-resident managing agent by furnishing the Commission with one copy of the process, pleadings, or papers, for each named party, and one additional copy for the Commission's records.

elements.title: Forwarding documents by the Secretary
elements.statement: The Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

elements.title: Certification of service by the Secretary
elements.statement: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

elements.title: Definition of Managing agent
elements.statement: Managing agent means any person, including a trustee, who directs or manages, or who participates in directing or managing, the affairs of any unincorporated organization or association other than a partnership.

elements.title: Definition of Non-resident
elements.statement: Non-resident means an individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; a corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States; and a partnership or other unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

elements.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document outlines the procedure for proceedings initiated by the filing of an application or by the Commission's own motion under any section of the Act or related rules. It specifies the publication of notice in the Federal Register, the process for interested persons to submit facts or request a hearing, and the conditions under which the Commission will order a hearing. It also defines 'application' for the purposes of this rule.

elements.title: Notice of proceeding initiation
elements.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

terms.reason: The term is a general concept related to communication.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a key part of the procedure.

terms.reason: The term describes a process or event.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is central to the statement's context.

terms.reason: The term is a specific publication.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly named as the publication medium.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal decision or directive.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key outcome of the proceeding.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject or issue at hand.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe what the order will address.

The verb phrase describes the action of indicating the date.
elements.reason: The statement prescribes a mandatory procedure for publishing notice and indicating dates.

elements.title: Submission of facts and hearing request
elements.statement: Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to any individual or entity with a stake in the proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a participant in the process.

terms.reason: The term refers to a duration within which actions must be taken.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to specify the timeframe for submissions.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly named as the recipient of submissions.

terms.reason: The term refers to information relevant to the proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is central to the submission process.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal meeting or session.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key part of the request process.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject or issue at hand.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe what the hearing will address.

terms.reason: The term refers to justifications or explanations.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is part of the requirement for requesting a hearing.

terms.reason: The term describes the type or extent of interest in the matter.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is required to be stated in the request.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase describes the action of submitting facts.
The verb phrase describes the action of requesting a hearing.
The verb describes the action of providing reasons.
elements.reason: The statement outlines the rights and procedures for interested persons to submit facts and request a hearing.

elements.title: Issuance of order disposing of the matter
elements.statement: An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal decision or directive.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key outcome of the proceeding.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject or issue at hand.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe what the order will address.

terms.reason: The term refers to a duration within which actions must be taken.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to specify the timeframe for issuing the order.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly named as the entity that may order a hearing.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal meeting or session.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a potential outcome if the Commission decides to order it.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase describes the action of issuing an order.
The verb describes the action of ordering a hearing.
elements.reason: The statement prescribes the procedure for issuing an order unless a hearing is ordered.

elements.title: Commission orders a hearing
elements.statement: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors, upon the request of any interested person or upon its own motion.

terms.reason: The term refers to a specific regulatory body.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly named as the entity that orders a hearing.

terms.reason: The term refers to a formal meeting or session.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is a key part of the procedure.

terms.reason: The term refers to the subject or issue at hand.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is used to describe what the hearing will address.

terms.reason: The term describes a consideration for ordering a hearing.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is part of the criteria for ordering a hearing.

terms.reason: The term describes a consideration for ordering a hearing.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is part of the criteria for ordering a hearing.

terms.reason: The term refers to any individual or entity with a stake in the proceeding.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned as a participant in the process.

verb_symbols_extracted_reason: The verb phrase describes the action of ordering a hearing.
The verb describes the condition for ordering a hearing.
The verb phrase describes the necessity condition.
The verb phrase describes the appropriateness condition.
elements.reason: The statement outlines the conditions under which the Commission will order a hearing.

elements.title: Definition of application
elements.statement: For purposes of this rule, an “application” means any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.

terms.reason: The term is defined within the context of the rule.

function.name: ElementsDocumentModel

content.summary: This document defines what constitutes a 'small business' or 'small organization' under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 for the purposes of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. It specifies criteria related to assets under management, total assets, and control relationships to determine if an investment adviser qualifies as a small entity. It also provides definitions for 'control' and 'total assets' in this context.

elements.title: Definition of small business or small organization
elements.statement: The term small business or small organization for purposes of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 shall mean an investment adviser that has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate.

terms.reason: The term is a general category defined by specific criteria.

elements.title: Assets under management criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser has assets under management, as defined under Section 203A(a)(3) of the Act and reported on its annual updating amendment to Form ADV, of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate.

elements.title: Total assets criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

terms.reason: The term is a specific role within the financial industry.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

elements.reason: The statement provides a criterion for classification as a small entity based on total assets.

elements.title: Control relationship criterion
elements.statement: An investment adviser does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more, or any person (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

terms.reason: The term is a specific role within the financial industry.

elements.title: Definition of control
elements.statement: Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.

terms.reason: The term refers to a power relationship between entities.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly defined in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the ability to influence or direct behavior.

elements.title: Presumption of control over a corporation
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity other than a natural person.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the legal entitlement to participate in decision-making processes.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial instruments that give the holder the right to vote on corporate matters.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

The verb is used to describe possession.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on voting rights in a corporation.

elements.title: Presumption of control over a partnership
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity other than a natural person.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a legal form of business operation between two or more individuals who share management and profits.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the entitlement to assets when a partnership is dissolved.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial assets or the financial value of assets.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

The verb is used to describe possession.
The verb is used to describe contribution.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on capital contribution in a partnership.

elements.title: Presumption of control over an LLC
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a limited liability company (LLC) if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC, has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the LLC, or is an elected manager of the LLC.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity other than a natural person.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a business structure that combines the pass-through taxation of a partnership with the limited liability of a corporation.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the legal entitlement to participate in decision-making processes.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to the entitlement to assets when an LLC is dissolved.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to financial assets or the financial value of assets.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual chosen to manage an LLC.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

The verb is used to describe possession.

The verb is used to describe a state of being.
elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on voting rights, capital contribution, or management role in an LLC.

elements.title: Presumption of control over a trust
elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.

terms.reason: The term refers to an entity other than a natural person.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to a fiduciary relationship in which one party holds legal title to property for the benefit of another.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

terms.reason: The term refers to an individual or organization that holds or manages and invests assets for the benefit of another.
terms.extracted_reason: The term is explicitly mentioned in the document.

elements.reason: The statement provides a presumption of control based on the role of trustee or managing agent in a trust.

elements.title: Definition of total assets
elements.statement: Total assets means the total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described above under paragraph (a)(3) of this section, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.

terms.reason: The term refers to the sum of all assets owned by an entity.
